channel.title: Which languages can you speak?
channel.description:
Which languages can you speak beyond a tourist-survival level? (being able to say your name, age and ask for directions does not count. You should be able to hold a conversation in the language to be considered "able to speak it" :P)
I can speak English and am near-fluent in Spanish, and I am currently learning Portuguese.

item.title: Which languages can you speak?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

I speak Norwegian and that’s it.

Read full topic

item.title: Which languages can you speak?
item.dc:creator: @thakillah thakillah
item.description:
@thakillah wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:16, topic:538676”][quote author=thakillah link=topic=657505.msg4398533#msg4398533 date=1389891554]
Dutch, German,French and English:p
Anyhow, they don’t teach many languages in England don’t they?
[/quote]

French, German and Spanish are the main ones. You can take exams in most other languages (and gain qualifications in them) if you are willing to study them outside of school. This is my aim with Portuguese.[/quote]
In the Netherlands, in high school, you get up to 2 years of French, German, which are compulsory subjects, I have chosen to continue to learn these languages.

Read full topic

item.title: Which languages can you speak?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

KroniKz_:

Fluent in English and Italian, and I’m in Spanish 3 in high school, so not too bad with Spanish.

How is Italian compared to Spanish? If it similar to Spanish then I may look into it after Portuguese.

Read full topic

item.title: Which languages can you speak?
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:3, topic:538676”][quote author=vManlyMan link=topic=657505.msg4398418#msg4398418 date=1389828188]
I can have simple conversations in Spanish, and I’ve been wanting to teach myself Russian for a while. I’m going to wait until I’m done with High school to start Russian though. It’d be too confusing trying to learn Spanish and Russian at the same time.

Oh and I can obviously speak English.
[/quote]

What makes you want to learn Russian? I plan to spend a few years in either Spain or South America in a year or two which is why I want to be fluent in Spanish and Portuguese.[/quote]

I’ve always been interested in Russian culture and the history of Russia. I don’t know why though.

Read full topic

item.title: Which languages can you speak?

item.description:
@Travas wrote:

I took a couple years of Spanish, but the only thing I learned how to say was a dirty joke.

Read full topic
